152 - 20 Feb 2024 11:55AM - +263 71 838 9027: 2. BPM (Business Process Management)life cycle The BPM includes five stages 1.Design . This is where the business process is mapped out and analysed 2.Model.The process is modeled in a way that makes it easy to understand and improve. 3Execute.The process is implemented and monitored to make sure it's working as intended 4.Monitor.  The process is monitored to identify issues or bottlenecks 5.Optimize.The process is optimized based on monitoring results.  3.Business can promote economic growth in a number of ways for example Business creates Jobs ,  that helps reduce unemployment and increase the income of workers , which in turn boosts consumer spending and drives economic growth. Business also creates productivity.By investing in technology or other productivity - enhancing measures , businesses can increase output without increasing costs . This helps to drive economic growth by increasing the amount of goods and services available in the economy Business encourages innovation.Businesses can drive economic growth by developing new products and services that meet consumer needs .this helps to drive consumer spending and increase economic growth

256 - 20 Feb 2024 11:31AM - Gurvinder: First, the cost of education without the scholarship is $6000-8000, Referring to this image let me re-explain the financial aspect of the program in 3 parts.  1. The Enrollment fee is $350 which includes application forms, statement of purpose, letter of recommendation, visa assistance, Earn While You Learn Program's training etc.  2. The Registration fee would be between $500-$1000, basically if you recall I did brief you after your university interaction with multiple universities, you would have to reserve your seat in 1 particular university you would have to pay a registration fee. Now usually Registration fee for a student is a separate expense altogether, however for an Edoofian it is considered a part of the first year's annual fee.  Say suppose, after the scholarship your fee is $2200, and you are being asked to pay $500 as a registration fee.  Now, being an Edoofa Applicant you have the privilege here of the registration fee being adjusted against your Tuition fee.  Hence the amount of $500 paid as registration fee will be waived off from your Fee and after that, the balance of ($2200-$500=$1700) has to be paid after coming to India in August/September of the year you come in 2 installments. The first part will be $1000 which you will pay in August 2024-25 and the remaining $700 in January 2025-26.  3. The Annual fee after the scholarship as discussed above would be between $2000-$3000, and this would include Accommodation, Food Expenses, and Basic University Expenses such as exam fees, Library Fee, and Lab Fee However if a student is able to clear the Eligibility Check test and Interview with over 90 marks, a student is eligible to get a 90% to 100% scholarship where the Annual fee after the scholarship would be between $1250-$1500, which would include Accommodation, Food Expenses, and Basic University Expenses such as exam fees, Library Fee,¬†and¬†Lab¬†Fee

Rwanda was a devastated country it's basic structure was destroyed , millions of people were displaced and many surviving Tutsis had lost their families . Many women suffered the consequences of rape and sexual violence . Today Rwanda has rebuilt from the ashes of horrific tragedy . Rwanda's drive to rebuild it's economy after the genocide has been driven by three main sources which is the export of tea and coffee , foreign aid which constituted gross annual income and the tourism trade. After the genocide about thousands of refugees remained in exile. The economy of Rwanda has undergone rapid industrialization due to a successful governmental policy, it has a mixed economy. Countless survivors developed long term psychological problems. However, over time Rwanda rebuilt itself and survivors played an important role in it's development. Economically, it eeoded the country's ability to  attract private and external investment. However it has now made significant progress in stabilitising and rehabilitating it's economy. Over the years Rwanda noted the significant improvement in terms of access to utilities . Access to health care was also improving although there were disparities between urban and rural communities. The country has come farther than even the most optimistic observers would have predicted .All this development is important to recognize because It has been the governments policy to express policy to deliver basic services and economic growth to it's people in order to mitigate the genocide ideology .There were several  grenade attacks  in Kigali. There were ongoing complaints about democratic principles . Travelling was bound to be a bumpy ride . In the months leading to elections they had, independent and opposition  media outlets were banned and opposition candidates were harassed . Some where arrested and banned from taking part in election processes while others fled from the country . Presidents were only allowed to rule two seven year terms. Survivors reported that they had experienced on average twelve different types of traumatic event types in comparison to different types of  traumatic successors. Most reports were mainly linked to witnessing violence throughout the period of the genocide whereas other former prisoners emphasized being physically attacked referring to their time spent in refugee camps  or to imprisonment. A regression analysis of data of the parent generation revealed that the exposure to traumatic successors,the level of physical illness and the level of social intergration  were predictors of PTSD whereas economic status, age and gender were not. There were demonstrations of  particular long term  consequences of massive organized violence such as war and genocide , on mental health and psychological conditions. Differences between families of survivers and of prisoners were accused of participating in the genocide .
